intro: Illicium wuyishanum, commonly known as the Wuyishan star anise, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruit that resembles the common star anise. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers and has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to star anise. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
